data.title: RNG issues
data.body:
Had a few issues using renpy.random a few days ago, and wanted to make some suggestions because of it.

I was writing an element for a screen that used random numbers to add a bit of variation.  Using renpy.random to get those numbers, though, resulted in some images jumping around as the screen re-rendered.  I'm not sure whether this is fixable without a major overhaul.

Well, I didn't need _really_ random numbers for my application, so I decided to create a small pool at init time, where I discovered that renpy.random was set to None, probably to maintain serialization of the RNG during game run.  Understandable.  I finally imported python's random and used that.

This leads me to two suggestions:

(1) Make renpy.random available at init for coder convenience, perhaps with a different salt from game time, then reset it when game is started.

(2) Make new PRNG instances available at run time.  Suggested format:

```
$ pool = renpy.random.pool(<seed>)
```

If <seed> isn't present, find a way to seed this consistently, perhaps from a hash of the file name and line #.  Then, access pool with pool.random(), pool.randint(), pool.choice().

data.title: android-presplash.jpg and android-icon.png may not work.
ui.screen_id()
data.body:
We need a function that lets us do something like:

```
$ ui.screen_id("what", my_cdd.my_text)
```

in case not every displayable is created by the screen itself.

data.body: For instance, this can be used this to compile RAPT without requiring a prior full native build of Ren'Py (a native build is still required to run the APK builder).

data.title: renpy-6.99.[01]-source.tar.bz2 fail to build: module/include/style_common.pxi is missing
data.body:
The tarballs lack `module/include/style_common.pxi`

```
$ RENPY_DEPS_INSTALL=/usr/local python2.7 setup.py build
_renpysteam is out of date.
warning: _renpysteam.pyx:280:52: local variable 'v' referenced before assignment
renpy.style is out of date.
renpy.styledata.styleclass is out of date.
renpy.styledata.stylesets is out of date.
gen/style_selected_hover_functions.pyx depends on style_common.pxi, which can't be found.
```

and the following Cython output (if generated by 0.21.1 under `/home/tom/ab/renpy/module/`)

```
$ diff -ur gen.bak/ gen/
Only in gen/: _renpysteam.cc
Only in gen/: style_activate_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_hover_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_idle_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_insensitive_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_selected_activate_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_selected_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_selected_hover_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_selected_idle_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: style_selected_insensitive_functions.pyx
Only in gen/: styleclass.pxi
Only in gen/: styleconstants.pxi
Only in gen/: stylesets.pxi
```

data.title: Remove old .rpyc files on "Force Recompile"
data.body:
Otherwise, compiling may fail in case there some orphaned (without .rpy) .rpyc with same labels as in other scripts (usually happens on script rename).

The only problem with this i can see is that it may affect .rpyc files in renpy/common. Not sure if that is a real problem and whether or not those files are touched without this change.

data.title: CardGame.py: Card marker implementation not complete?
data.body:
Looks like a renaming of 'highlights' to 'markers' was left incomplete;

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
...
  File "game/cardgame.rpy", line 207, in render
    c.render_to(rv, width, height, st, at)
  File "game/cardgame.rpy", line 614, in render_to
    if self.highlights:
AttributeError: '_m1_cardgame__Card' object has no attribute 'highlights'
```

However, renaming the attributes consistently doesn't fix the feature, as there's a rendering problem once markers are added:

```
I'm sorry, but an uncaught exception occurred.

While running game code:
  ...
  File "game/cardgame.rpy", line 207, in render
    c.render_to(rv, width, height, st, at)
  File "game/cardgame.rpy", line 617, in render_to
    surf = renpy.render(d, width, height, st, at)
ValueError: subsurface rectangle outside surface area
```

Is this an implementation that was never quite finished?

data.title: SpriteManager: update_args to allow universal update functions
data.body:
Add update_args to SpriteManager and pass it as
kwargs to update function, so that it's possible
to have update function universal among multiple
SpriteManagers.

data.title: Added channels don't stop when load a game
data.body:
Added channels don't stop when load a game.

For example

 I added a new channel.
    renpy.music.register_channel("sound2", mixer="sfx", loop = False)

I played sound by the channel.
    play sound2 hogehoge loop

I loaded some game, but the channel is playing even if after load.
